parts.title: Fill the Correct Preposition
parts.hint: Use only: bez / do / z / od / u

exercises.prompt: I need a bit of time.
I have a lot of work.
I bought a kilo of apples.
I want a bottle of water.
I don't have any energy today.
I need a bit of help.
I have a lot of questions.
I drank a glass of water.
I bought two bottles of water and one bottle of wine.
exercises.answer: Koupil jsem dvě láhve vody a jednu láhev vína.

exercises.prompt: I have five minutes and then I'm leaving.
exercises.answer: Mám pět minut a pak odcházím.

exercises.prompt: Except Friday, I'm busy every day.
exercises.answer: Kromě pátku jsem zaneprázdněný každý den.

exercises.prompt: During the week I have little time, but on weekends I have more.
exercises.answer: Během týdne mám málo času, ale o víkendech mám víc.

exercises.prompt: Without your phone number, I can't call you.
exercises.answer: Bez tvého telefonního čísla ti nemůžu zavolat.

exercises.prompt: Without your help, I can't do it.
During the week I don't have time.
According to the map, it's near the center.
exercises.answer: Podle mapy je to blízko centra.

exercises.prompt: Instead of coffee, I want tea.
I'm not afraid of dogs, but I'm afraid of heights.
exercises.answer: Nebojím se psů, ale bojím se výšek.

exercises.prompt: I'll ask my boss about it.
exercises.answer: Zeptám se na to svého šéfa.

exercises.prompt: According to him, it's not possible.
Instead of going to work, I'm going to the doctor.
exercises.answer: Místo toho, abych šel do práce, jdu k doktorovi.

exercises.prompt: During the whole week I didn't have time.
exercises.answer: Během celého týdne jsem neměl čas.
Kromě mého kamaráda to nikdo neví.

exercises.prompt: According to the schedule, we start at 9.

parts.title: Build the Phrase with an Adjective

exercises.prompt: from the biggest city in the country
a little bit of hot soup

parts.title: Pronouns (Genitive)
parts.hint: Focus: pronouns with bez / od / z / do / u, plus bát se / zeptat se, and demonstratives (toho/té/těch). Fill blanks with the correct genitive pronoun form.

subsections.title: Interrogatives/Relatives: koho / čeho / kterého / které / kterých (126–135)
Verb Triggers (genitive): bát se / zeptat se / týkat se (146–150)

Except Friday, I'm busy every day.
Kromě pátku jsem zaneprázdněný každý den.
During the week I have little time, but on weekends I have more.
Během týdne mám málo času, ale o víkendech mám víc.
Without your phone number, I can't call you.
Bez tvého telefonního čísla ti nemůžu zavolat.
Without your help, I can't do it.
According to the map, it's near the center.
Podle mapy je to blízko centra.
Instead of coffee, I want tea.
I'm not afraid of dogs, but I'm afraid of heights.
Nebojím se psů, ale bojím se výšek.
According to him, it's not possible.
Instead of going to work, I'm going to the doctor.
Místo toho, abych šel do práce, jdu k doktorovi.
Kromě mého kamaráda to nikdo neví.
According to the schedule, we start at 9.
